Hello, welcome to GRE Word Games! I'll start with the story of this application. A few years ago, I was preparing for my own GRE test, and I spent months making flashcards and trying to memorize all the words. However, because I compiled my database from various resources, I could not have any app where I could input my words and revise my words. And thus, GRE Word Games was created. I finally had my, 'alright, I will do it myself' moment! 

The objective of this app is fairly simple, you input your own words, and the app gives you a word at random, then you think whether you know its meaning, and once you hit submit, the app will display the actual word meaning to you. You can either record it as right or wrong, which allows you to keep track of the words you are struggling with. You can adjust the difficulty of your practice session before starting. Let's discuss the various difficulty levels next.

1. Fully Random Difficulty: This is the default difficulty, you get a word at random, then another one, and so on, independent of any other factors. 

2. Standard Difficulty: All of your words are classified into four groups: new words, difficult words (with low proficiency), medium words (with low to high proficiency) and easy words (with high proficiency). You get words in batches. The batches go easy -> difficulty -> new -> medium before looping over. This helps to ensure there is a greater focus on the words you are struggling with. All of the batches are of the same size. 

3. New Biased Difficulty: This is same as the standard difficulty, except a greater emphasis is put on the new words by increasing the number of words in the new words batch, 

4. Struggling Biased Difficulty: This is same as the standard difficulty, except a greater emphasis is put on the words you are having low proficiency by increasing the number of words in the struggling words batch, 

5. Nightmare Difficulty: Instead of the four batches of the standard difficulty, there are only two batches, new words, and difficult words. This is useful when you want to only focus on improving your words without revising.

My Words: You can view all the words you have added to your database on the My Words section. It allows you to keep track of your progress, view when you added the words and your proficiency at each word. 

Cross Platform Access: You can use this application across various devices. The data is updated real time and you can log in to any device to access your account, add new words and practice them.

Mneumonics: The ability to create your own flashcard by tapping on the word in the My Words section and adding a mneumonic. 

Multiplayer practice: The ability to play an online playing game with your friends where you draw to guess the right word, which could serve not only as a fun game but helping you remember words through association. 

If you have any other suggestions which you would like to have in the application, feel free to email me at achirmul@asu.edu.

\nHey, I am Advait Chirmule, the creator of the app. I am a student at Arizona State University. I created the first, personal version of this application back in 2022, but now I am redoing it to release it on a larger scale with the new knowledge I have accumulated over the years. You can contact me on my email ID (achirmul@asu.edu) and I look forward to hearing back your feedback about the applications, and if you have any other ideas that I can implement! Thank you for playing and I wish you the best of luck in your GRE!
